docs.snippet: At a seafood restaurant in Virginia, Mr. Khan made his first appearance on the campaign trail for Hillary Clinton but said his mission transcended politics....
docs.lead_paragraph: At a seafood restaurant in Virginia, Mr. Khan made his first appearance on the campaign trail for Hillary Clinton but said his mission transcended politics.
docs.abstract: Khizr Khan, father of slain soldier Humayun Khan and critic of Donald Trump, makes first appearance on campaign trail for Hillary Clinton in Virginia; Khan, sent to state to appeal to veterans, contends Trump is temperamentally unfit to be commander in chief.

headline.main: With a Politician’s Flair, Khizr Khan Tries to Push Clinton to Finish Line
headline.print_headline: With a Politician’s Flair, Khan Aims to Lift Clinton

docs.snippet: Readers discuss an article that argued, “In politics, hypocrisy and doublespeak are tools.”...

docs.snippet: Trailing with time running out, Donald Trump denounced both Hillary and Bill Clinton Thursday as creatures of a corrupt political system who would use another pass at the Oval Office to enrich themselves at the expense of American families. Clinto...
docs.lead_paragraph: Trailing with time running out, Donald Trump denounced both Hillary and Bill Clinton Thursday as creatures of a corrupt political system who would use another pass at the Oval Office to enrich themselves at the expense of American families. Clinton turned to popular first lady Michelle Obama to rally voters in North Carolina, a state that could deliver a knockout blow to Trump.

headline.main: Trump Hits 'Corrupt' Hillary Clinton; Mrs. Obama Hugs Her
headline.print_headline: Trump Hits 'Corrupt' Hillary Clinton; Mrs. Obama Hugs Her

docs.snippet: Donald Trump's dubious claims the presidential election is "rigged" have taken root among most of his supporters, who say they will have serious doubts about the legitimacy of the election's outcome if Hillary Clinton wins, according to a new Asso...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump's dubious claims the presidential election is "rigged" have taken root among most of his supporters, who say they will have serious doubts about the legitimacy of the election's outcome if Hillary Clinton wins, according to a new Associated Press-GfK poll.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump criticized Democrat Hillary Clinton on Thursday over her trade policies, saying she would handle trade deals so badly that the country should "just cancel the election" and name him the victor.
